Experience Hourly Paid Lecturer University of South Wales November 2014  – Present (9 months) Delivering tutorial sessions for a university foundation year support studies module, providing advice and assistance to students and marking assignment papers. Web IT Tutor Penrhys Partnership September 2014  – Present (11 months) Treorchy Job Centre Running weekly 2 hour tutorial sessions for groups of up to 5 adults as part of a 3 week 'Web for Work' course (the courses are rolling - a new group starts the week following one group finishing).  
The course covers essential skills needed for applying for jobs online, and includes creation of professional looking CVs and cover letters, using emails and job searching websites confidently, and generally improving computer skills. Student Ambassador First Campus July 2014  – Present (1 year 1 month) Assisting in the running of multiple events run by First Campus for children in Community First areas in South Wales.  
One such event was a year 9 residential, where students ambassadors like myself were responsible for up to 5 year 9 pupils staying in university halls of accommodation, and generally helping with the smooth running of activities and providing assistance to the supervisors running the event.  
Another event was providing campus tours and helping running a university experience day for students of varying ages in foster care.  
Other events include stewarding for a touring science show at the university, and assisting GCSE exam revision techniques sessions in a local high school. Student Ambassador Technocamps September 2013  – Present (1 year 11 months) Planning and delivering computing based after school clubs and running various workshop sessions to children aged 8-18. The clubs were designed to teach basic programming skills, introduce important computer science concepts and generally encourage pupils passion in computing, with the aim of increasing awareness and interest in computer science courses in higher education. Our project is divided into three stages: primary, advanced and graduation project stage.  
 
• Primary stage gives students an overall view of the basics of research, Systematic thinking, English speaking skills and Personal soft skills. 
 
• Advanced stage gives students more advanced information on a specific scientific branch of science and condensed content needed to help them go on with their researches. 
 
• Graduation project where each group of students can live their own scientific research experience under supervision of members from the scientific committee.

MDGs in Africa provides updates and news on the Millennium Development Goals in Africa. The aim of this youth-initiated tool is to connect young people to the inspiring stories of the eight goals in Africa. This helps to promote continuous efforts towards sustainable development on the continent. The more positive stories we share, the better Africa becomes.

These ambassadors:

Ambassadors are thrilled by new technology, enthusiastic about Google, and involved in their school communities. They have majors from Computer Science, to Anthropology, to Business, to Zoology!  
 
Google Ambassadors have the opportunity to enhance their professional development, leadership, and communication skills, and access to a unique network of Google Ambassadors across the United States. Plus, there’s swag!  
 
The Google Student Ambassador program consists of students Google has met over the years through mutual passion for technology and innovation, and is currently by nomination only. The program is one school year in length. Summary Freeda is a recent graduate from a Bachelor of Science at the University of Queensland, who has now continued further tertiary studies in the field of Speech Pathology. In her experiences, she has been able to work with autistic children and has found it a most rewarding and humbling experience to be able to observe the growth in language and personal development in these children. Freeda is a strong believer in effective communication, as she believes that it is human's greatest functioning tool. Freeda is a keen learner and strives to enhance her life through experiences, whether it be work, social or volunteer means. View Summer Analyst - Balance Sheet Management Desk - Product Control HSBC June 2012  –  August 2012  (3 months) London, United Kingdom I was responsible for creating a monthly toolkit pack for the finance team which was particularly useful in accessing the bank's position in light of the Eurozone crisis and aided Asset Liability Management processes.  
As this internship was during the outburst of the Eurozone crisis (peaking of the Greek crisis), I worked on tracking and flagging the credit risk or expsoure for the Bond traders for apporpraite risk management.  
I was also involved in the daily P&L process 
I also attended several networking events to learn more about the different divisions in the bank as well as learning about other banks. The LUMS International Transition Guide Scheme Edit Project Assistant PKF (UK) LLP August 2011  –  September 2011  (2 months) London, United Kingdom As part of the International Projects Group, I worked extensively on creating Expression of Interests Packs which the team used to bid for International development projects in the fields of Public Finance Management, Private Sector development, Audit, management consultancy, public and private sector for funding bodies such as EC,DANIDA, USAID, AFD, and DFID. 
I was mostly responsible for searching for new viable projects, searching and signing experts to work on these pojects with us. Part of this process involved me formating CVs and verifying documents for submission as well as translation of some documents from French to English and vvice versa (I can read very basic French). 
I also did the due diligence on visa applications for the team to carry out audit checks for all our active projects in Timor Leste and Afghanistan as well as a business conference in Zanzibar. 
In addition to my project work, I assisted in the internal audit process and networked with key stakeholders for current and prospective projects
